item.title: Millions Impacted by PowerSchool Data Breach
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Four decades of student and educator information was stolen from PowerSchool â€“ tens of millions are potentially affected.

The post Millions Impacted by PowerSchool Data Breach appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Industry Moves for the week of January 20, 2025 - SecurityWeek
item.description: Explore industry moves and significant changes in the industry for the week of January 20, 2025. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and shifts.

item.title: Cyber Insights 2025: Social Engineering Gets AI Wings
item.dc:creator: Kevin Townsend
item.description:
Business resilience must be the ultimate purpose of all the security controls and processes we employ, because we will never conclusively defeat or protect ourselves from social engineering.

The post Cyber Insights 2025: Social Engineering Gets AI Wings appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Hackers Earn $886,000 at Pwn2Own Automotive 2025 for Charger, OS, Infotainment Exploits
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Pwn2Own Automotive 2025 has come to an end and participants have earned a total of $886,000 for exploits targeting EV chargers and infotainment systems.

The post Hackers Earn $886,000 at Pwn2Own Automotive 2025 for Charger, OS, Infotainment Exploits appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Palo Alto Networks Addresses Impact of BIOS, Bootloader Vulnerabilities on Its Firewalls
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Eclypsium warns that Palo Alto Networks firewalls are impacted by BIOS and bootloader flaws, but the vendor says users should not be concerned.

The post Palo Alto Networks Addresses Impact of BIOS, Bootloader Vulnerabilities on Its Firewalls appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Conduent Confirms Cyberattack After Government Agencies Report Outages
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Conduent has confirmed suffering disruptions due to a cyberattack after government agencies reported service outages.

The post Conduent Confirms Cyberattack After Government Agencies Report Outages appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Cyber Insights 2025: Malware Directions
item.dc:creator: Kevin Townsend
item.description:
The continuing advance of AI brings the likelihood of effective, specific vulnerability-targeted new malware automatically produced in hours rather than days or weeks ever closer.

The post Cyber Insights 2025: Malware Directions appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Axoflow Raises $7 Million for Security Data Curation Platform
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Security data pipeline management startup Axoflow has raised $7 million in a seed funding round led by EBRD Venture Capital.

The post Axoflow Raises $7 Million for Security Data Curation Platform appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Homebrew macOS Users Targeted With Information Stealer Malware
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
A malicious campaign has been redirecting macOS users to a fake Homebrew website, infecting them with information stealer malware.

The post Homebrew macOS Users Targeted With Information Stealer Malware appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Tesla Charger Exploits Earn Hackers $129,000 at Pwn2Own
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Hackers earned more than $700,000 on the first two days of Pwn2Own Automotive 2025 for EV charger and infotainment exploits.

The post Tesla Charger Exploits Earn Hackers $129,000 at Pwn2Own appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Cisco Patches Critical Vulnerability in Meeting Management
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Cisco has released patches for three vulnerabilities, including a critical privilege escalation bug and a DoS flaw for which exploit code exists.

The post Cisco Patches Critical Vulnerability in Meeting Management appeared first on SecurityWeek.
